text: simply put we wanted to create something
the likes of which Chicago had never
seen unlike New York where people think
about building in terms of the
developers and development in Chicago
people think about the architect
architecture in Chicago has a deep
history people really take pride in the
fact that it's the home of the
skyscraper Adrian Smith is an architect
as part of a lineage in Chicago he's
responsible for the Trump Hotel and
millennium park so there's something
deeply ingrained about millennium park
that the city has really embraced the
Trump Hotel I think everyone has given
it its due but I don't know if its
beloved in the same way Chicago has
always been a city with a bit of a chip
on its shoulder Trump is from New York
and Chicago winds tend to have a very
visceral response to New Yorkers coming
to Chicago to do this kind of project
but on one level he built the building
that people are happy with
but he then put his name on it then that
made people unhappy with it I was
horrified those letters I believe or 22
feet high I'll have people come into my
unit and all they like oh there it is Oh
Adrian Smith was not happy the Mayor was
not happy
[Music]
if a teenager takes a marker and writes
his name on the side of a building it's
graffiti and I don't think this is all
that different from that Chicago price
itself on its architecture and I think
what speaks for itself
[Music]
